CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The non-fullerene PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and di-PBI exhibits a PCE of 4.23% with V OC = 0.77 V , J SC = 9.8 mA cm^-2 and FF = 0.56 ( Fig.

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |
| di-PBI |

The first material name is "PTATDPP" and the second one is "di-PBI". These entities are mentioned in the context of the non-fullerene photovoltaic cell (PSC) fabrication process.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After reviewing the paragraph again, I realize that there is only one clear material name mentioned, which is "PTATDPP". The other material name "di-PBI" is not clearly defined or described in the paragraph, so I cannot confirm that it is a material name.

Therefore, the valid material name entity is:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |

I apologize for any confusion earlier.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The non-fullerene PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and di-PBI exhibits a PCE of 4.23% with V OC = 0.77 V , J SC = 9.8 mA cm^-2 and FF = 0.56 ( Fig.

Let's think step by step.

Here are the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph:

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| V OC |
| J SC |
| FF |

The first entity, "PCE", stands for power conversion efficiency. The second entity, "V OC", represents open-circuit voltage. The third entity, "J SC", denotes short-circuit current density. The last entity, "FF", is the fill factor. These are all common terms used to describe the performance of a photovoltaic cell or solar cell.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After reviewing the paragraph, I have determined that all of the identified entities are related to material properties. Therefore, there is no need to remove any entities. Here are the valid "Property Name" entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| V OC |
| J SC |
| FF |

These entities are all important material properties used to evaluate the performance of a photovoltaic cell or solar cell.

Paragraph: The non-fullerene PSC fabricated from the blend of PTATDPP and di-PBI exhibits a PCE of 4.23% with V OC = 0.77 V , J SC = 9.8 mA cm^-2 and FF = 0.56 ( Fig.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 4.23% |
| 0.77 V |
| 9.8 mA cm^-2 |
| 0.56 |

Note that "V OC", "J SC", and "FF" are not included as they are not property values but rather abbreviations for open-circuit voltage, short-circuit current density, and fill factor, respectively.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

After removing entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property", we are left with the following "Property Value" entity:

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 4.23% |

The other values "V OC = 0.77 V", "J SC = 9.8 mA cm^-2", and "FF = 0.56" are not included as they are not values of a single material property but rather different properties of the photovoltaic cell.
